samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was developed as an implementation of the S programming language with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names. Since its initial development, R has become an open-source project maintained by the R Core Team.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. Since its initial development, R has become an open-source project maintained by the R Core Team.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R after its initial development began in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R after its initial development began in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

The submission states "Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000." The submission provides more specific information (exact date), but it does include the correct year 2000, which is the key factual content in the expert answer.

While the submission goes on to provide additional context about R's development history, this extra information doesn't contradict the expert answer - it just provides more detail.

Since the submission correctly includes the year 2000 as the release date for R version 1.0, it contains the factual content from the expert answer.

GRADE: C
